Scottie Scheffler family tree: Meet wife Meredith, son Bennett and more about golfer's family
Brendan OSullivan
•
Scottie Scheffler is one of the undisputed faces of golf with two Masters wins under his belt, even if there are more eccentric personalities throughout the sport.
Few players are more steady than Scheffler, who regularly finds himself near the top of the leaderboard in majors and has proven he can win on some of the toughest courses.
While winning the other three majors is still a goal for Scheffler, he has quite a long time to stack victories — and he has a strong family by his side to help him pursue them.
The golf world is familiar with Scheffler, but less known are his family members. Here's everything you need to know about the Scheffler family.
MORE:
Breaking down how much Scottie Scheffler has made in his career
Scottie Scheffler's family tree
Scottie Scheffler's wife: Meredith Scheffler
Scottie and Meredith got married in 2020 and celebrated their three-year anniversary in 2023.
View this post on Instagram
A post shared by Scottie Scheffler (@scottie.scheffler)
Meredith is a director with the nonprofit
Behind Every Door
. Behind Ever Door offers community centers for under represented Dallas neighborhoods.
The couple met in high school in Dallas. Before they got married in 2020, Meredith did not have experience golfing, but she did get a chance to caddie for Scottie at the 2022 and 2023 Masters' Par 3 contest.
MORE:
How did PGA golfers Sam Burns and Scottie Scheffler become close friends?
Scottie Scheffler's son: Bennett Scheffler
Bennett Scheffler is the newest member of the Scheffler family. Meredith gave birth to the couple's first child in May 2024, just before the start of the PGA Championship.
Meredith's pregnancy was a topic during the Masters the previous month. She wasn't expected to give birth just yet, but
Scheffler said he would leave Augusta if his wife went into labor
, creating the possibility that the leader would bow out of the tournament.
Scheffler went on to win the 2024 Masters, and Bennett was born after the tournament but before his dad traveled to Kentucky for the 2024 PGA Championship.
View this post on Instagram
A post shared by Scottie Scheffler (@scottie.scheffler)
Unfortunately for Bennett, his arrival was soon overshadowed by
his father's arrest
after a traffic misunderstanding on the way into the PGA Championship. Scheffler was able to continue his tournament and the charges would be dropped, but the story made more headlines than the family would have liked.
MORE:
Looking back at Scottie Scheffler's complete majors timeline
How many siblings does Scottie Scheffler have?
Scheffler is one of four siblings. He has three sisters Callie, Molly and Sara. Callie is the eldest of the bunch, with Scottie two years behind her. Molly and Sara are the youngest siblings.
Sara caddied for her brother in the Par 3 Contest at the 2024 Masters, and Scheffler's sisters are regularly involved in his career.
MORE:
Everything to know about the Masters Green Jacket
Who are Scottie Scheffler's parents?
Scheffler's parents are Scott and Diane Scheffler. The two started their family in New Jersey before moving to Dallas. Scott was a stay-at-home father, while Diane worked at a law firm.
Scheffler's parents joined him on the course during Masters practice rounds in 2025. Diane even hit some balls into the fairway despite Scheffler's father revealing, "She hasn't even swung a club in five years."
While Scheffler is all business when he's on the golf course, he keeps his family close by and seems to soak up every bit of family time when he's not playing or practicing.
MORE:
Ranking the 5 toughest courses in U.S. Open history
Brendan OSullivan
Brendan O'Sullivan is an editorial intern for Sporting News, joining in 2024. He previously worked at Newsday on Long Island, New York after graduating from Quinnipiac University.

Scottie Scheffler's Wife Meredith and Baby Son Bennett Adorably Caddie for Him at 2025 Masters
Scheffler and his wife welcomed Bennett in May 2024
By
Natasha Dye
Natasha Dye
Natasha Dye is a writer-reporter for PEOPLE covering sports. Her previous work appears in The New York Post and Popstar! Magazine.
People Editorial Guidelines
Published on April 9, 2025 05:00PM EDT
Leave a Comment
Scottie Scheffler and his wife Meredith Scheffler smile with their son Bennett during the Par Three Contest prior to the Masters Tournament at Augusta National Golf Club on April 9, 2025 in Augusta, Georgia.
Credit :
Ben Jared/PGA TOUR via Getty
Scottie Scheffler
had a very special caddie crew as he hit the course at the 2025 Masters Tournament.
The 28-year-old
reigning Masters champion
was spotted with his wife
Meredith Scudder
and
Bennett
, who was
born in May 2024
, at the August National Golf Club in Georgia on Wednesday, April 9.
Scudder and the couple's young son served as Scheffler's caddie during the Par 3 contest, a family-forward tradition of the tournament that dates back to 1960.
Bennett, wearing a white jumpsuit that said "Scheffler" on the back, took in the action from his father's arms during the family outing. The golf pro and his wife, who are
featured
on the third season of Netflix's docuseries
Full Swing
,
matched their son in white outfits as Bennett stole the show and adorably chewed on his collar.
Scottie Scheffler and his wife Meredith Scheffler smile with their son Bennett during the Par Three Contest prior to the Masters Tournament at Augusta National Golf Club on April 9, 2025 in Augusta, Georgia.
Ben Jared/PGA TOUR via Getty
Scheffler and Scudder, high school sweethearts at Highland Park High School in Dallas, married in 2020. The news that the couple were expecting their first child together broke in March 2024 when Scudder was seen with a
noticeable baby bump
as he won the Arnold Palmer Invitational.
All About Scottie Scheffler's Wife Meredith Scudder and Her Relationship with the Pro Golfer
They welcomed Bennett on May 8, 2024, just weeks after
Scheffler won
the 2024 Masters.
Scottie Scheffler of the United States reacts with his son Bennett during the Par Three Contest prior to the 2025 Masters Tournament at Augusta National Golf Club on April 9, 2025 in Augusta, Georgia.
David Cannon/Getty
Scudder did not attend the 2024 tournament as she awaited Bennett's arrival at the time, but Scheffler gave her a sweet shout out in his victory speech.
"To my lovely wife, Meredith. I love you, sweetheart," he said. "I'm excited to get home. I miss you."
Never miss a story — sign up for
PEOPLE's free daily newsletter
to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from juicy celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.
Scheffler announced his
mini-me's arrival
with a sweet post on
Instagram
a few days after Bennett was born. “Welcome to the world little one. Your mom & dad love you so much,” he captioned the post, giving his followers a glimpse of the newborn swaddled in white as the first-time dad cradled him in his arms.
Scottie Scheffler of The United States holds the trophy with his wife Meredith Scheffler after his one stroke win in the final round of the Arnold Palmer Invitational presented by Mastercard at Arnold Palmer Bay Hill Golf Course on March 06, 2022 in Orlando, Florida.
David Cannon/Getty
All About Scottie Scheffler’s Son, Bennett (and Why the Golfer Hopes He'll Follow in His Footsteps!)
Currently the No. 1 ranked golfer, Scheffler was able to celebrate another win just four months after his son's birth: the
2024 FedEx Cup
.
After his dad won the trophy, Bennett posed for fun photos to celebrate the win. "What a week! Shoutout to Bennett for being a good sport," Scheffler wrote when he shared the photos on
Instagram
.
